revision.text:
{{WikiProject Israel|class=stub|importance=low}} {{WPMILHIST|class=Stub|Middle-Eastern=yes}} ==Move to [[Human Resources Directorate]]?== I think the article should be moved, considering there are no other Human Resources Directorates with an article (are there any other HRDs at all??) -- [[User:Ynhockey|Ynhockey]] <sup>([[User talk:Ynhockey|Talk]])</sup> 18:03, 24 May 2006 (UTC)
==Add logo== After being renamed from Manpower Directorate to Human Resource Directorate, the insignia was also changed. The new version can be seen here: http://www1.idf.il/DOVER/site/mainpage.asp?clr=1&sl=HE&id=7&docid=51855 --[[User:83.130.90.42|83.130.90.42]] 18:49, 4 July 2006 (UTC)
==Translation of unit names== Sector > should be "Department"
Planning Brigade and Manpower Administration > Doesn't "Manpower Planning and Administration Brigade" work better?
-- [[User:Jacoby308|Jacoby308]] ([[User talk:Jacoby308|talk]]) 16:52, 25 June 2015 (UTC) :They're two different entities: Planning Brigade (חטיבת התכנון), and Manpower Administration (מנהל כוח אדם). However, they were merged and are a single unit now (division-level). —[[User:Ynhockey|Ynhockey]] <sup>([[User talk:Ynhockey|Talk]])</sup> 16:19, 27 June 2015 (UTC)
:: The unit's name is "חטיבת תכנון ומנהל כח אדם" - abbreviated "חתומכ"א". I've served in the unit for the past 6 years, and I'm not aware of any major changes that fit your description (at least for the past 20 years). Are you not referring to Meitav - which was created from the combined Bakum (בקו"ם) and Manhag (מנה"ג) ca. 2009? this might also be a good place to point out the need for a page for the brigade —[[User:Jacoby308|Jacoby308]] ([[User talk:Jacoby308|talk]]) 23:17, 27 June 2015 (UTC)
